reviewText:
Let's start out by saying that it's pretty obvious that we're dealing with a Tablet port here.
Not only do the controls obviously hint at this, but the tutorial screens (if you can already read the Asian characters) show actual instructions pertaining to tablet usage.

Sadly, however, this means that the game has 'tapping' expectancies. Meaning that, because reaction speeds are slower with a mouse (in particular to click a very specific region) compared to quickly tapping with a finger, that it'll take longer to actually point at something. Not to mention that the skill buttons are clickable with the mouse, meaning that if the fight takes place in the lower regions of the screen, that you'll often click them by accident.

But what of the Gameplay itself? Sadly, as it stands now, it's basically a hack-and-slash, giving you three stamina-using skills to use, a dash and a regular weak attack. Spamming these special attacks quickly drains your stamina, which will cause you to be temporarily stunned if said bar is completely depleted.

While you have the choice of one of three characters, you get the other two as soon as you´ve beaten about five bosses. These AI seem to be well capable of just spamming their own skills, but the enemy tends to have a preference for you anyway. Meaning you'll still be well busy keeping yourself alive.

And that's it. Tap to move or double tap to dash out of the way of an attack, keep laying on the heat and you're set. The character buttons that possibly serve to further define or gear up your character are not available yet". So we're obviously dealing with a Tablet port that also serves to just give a taste of what's to come
date: as the loading screens love to wave around that the actual release is dated for December.\n\nThere are no graphics options to speak of. No resolution options
recommended: either. Let alone anything else. Alt-Enter works to switch between Fullscreen and Windowed
hoursPlayed:
but that wasn't said anywhere.


Honestly? Unless the developers make some changes that clearly embrace the PC market or simply make it friendlier for them
voteText: I would avoid this game. EVEN IF ITS 3 DOLLARS.\n\nTake my opinion for what you will
helpfulPercent:
but I say that this has a lot of fixing ahead of it before I can consider it well playable.

UPDATE
Let's clarify this: If you start asking money for it
votesHelpful: it stops being a Beta and becomes a release. If you don't want your game judged that way
votesTotal: then don't ask money for it or don't release it yet.\nThe page also does not clarify the true nature of this game
votesFunny: as it being a 'preview' or a taste of a product to come.\n\nThis is not a practise we should condone. It's just milking money from people."

reviewText:
For 2 dollars, I'd say this is a nice game and a good adaption.

It really doesn't give bad graphics and despite being locked down to bad hotkeys (My opinion). It is really fun.

WASD is normal for me but the UIO and JK hotkeys threw me off a little at the beginning. That aside, for the short amount of time I have spent on this game thus far, its great. Especially for ONLY 2 dollars.

This isn't a big game, not really a RPG but more so to me a arena or a survival arena with some minimal aspects of a rpg. (The reason I don't say its an RPG is simply because it does not have a true story, the only role you're taking up is the heroes (classes) and all your doing is fighting bosses and progressing through the battles).

With that said for those interested in the game, don't hold back. If you enjoy boss battles or just challenging battles. This is for you. If you like Gladiator styled games (arenas) then try it out. I'm definitely not upset with the two dollars i gave this game.

It may not be completely done as well, for those who want to get with friends one day on this game or wants to fight them. They're setting up Co-Ops and PvP soon as well  - so again for only two dollars you're getting a good amount in return! Try it out!
voteText: 18 of 31 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I love the idea of this game and I feel like it is very very close to perfect. It just needs to actually be updated with what they say they are updating it with. There was supposed to be a giant addition patch that settle all my disputes with this game... but it never came. The date the update was supposed to be live is still posted in-game... it was supposed to be released 10 days ago and not a single word has been said. So sadly I cannot recommend this game until the patch goes live and it smoothes out. If you enjoy the idea of playing playstation bosses with basic MOBA characters then by all means play it.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pros :
- Low Cost
- Character Models and Sounds are cool enough
- Enjoyable in short bursts
- Difficulty is tweaked alright

Cons :
- Repetitive use of boss concepts and models (same half dozen with slifht tweaks over and over)
- Few cooldown abilities are only effective if you can orient your character in the right angle - weak controls -
- The short burts gameplay model works much better on a tablet when you dont have acess to your pc gaming rig
- Fights against other human characters are a messy brawl where you mostly fire around blindly

Conclusion :
For the cost - and what it offers - its a fair bargain. However the PC is really the wrong platform for this game and you will very quickly yearn for more depth in your gameplay, a story, some better sense of progression, and this game is not the one to deliver it. Still might be worth adding to your library if you get it in a bundle or for very cheap for a quick relief of your hack and slash itch
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is not even finished as such it should be branded as early access.
It took me 3 hours to finish the game, that is to finish all levels that are curently released.
Game claims that new levels will be released. The game boils down to Monster Hunter boss fights and boss fights only.
There is no way to power up your character other than grinding for levels.
Don't get me wrong I had my fun with the game. The first 20 minutes when you start the game are kinda fun.
Combat, bosses and music is good, but when you are forced to fught same boss 5 times just with diferent skin it gets boring. After some time it juste feels like some chore.
Attack>Attack>Attack>Roll>Use specials>Attack>Roll>Attack untill you have stamina for special>Attack>Boss Dead.
Later on it becomes even more boring cause they encrease the enemy health.

First time you fight robotic T-Rex:
Game: Hey you will now fight robotic T-Rex
Me: Ow yeah. Bring it on.
Game: You won!
Me: that was cool fight and music was nice.

Second time you fight robotic T-Rex:
Game: Hey you will now fight robotic T-Rex2.0
Me: Oh ok. Bring it on?
Game: You won!
Me: that was re-skin of a previous boss.
Game: Yeah but this one used laser that you easly dodged.

Seventh time you fight robotic T-Rex:
Game: Hey you will now fight robotic T-Rex again now with x5 HP and randomly shooting bombs
Me: Realy?
Game: You won!
Me: Yeah after failing 3 times cause timer run out before I was able to deliver finishing strike.

You can see where am I getting at later on timer becomes the boss.
So after all that is this game worth 2€. Maybe after they realease all the content.
As it is this is this game is not even finished as such it should be branded as early access.
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Loved the game but its almost inposible to beat 5 bar monsters and up.The Ai on the other hunters is terrible they will litterally stand in front of the monster and get 2 hit.Then you will be left and the time will run out before you can kill the monster :/.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Worth the 2$.

Though  atm, the fiddily camera angles take alittle getting use too.

WASD works as one would expected, if there is only 4 directional input (I couldn't tell, and felt like 8 directional, with smoothing to make it look decent)
-UIO/JK Sp attack./(attack/dodge) keys work well, & they have alternate key inputs that aren't clear.
--123/qe for sp attack/(attk/dodge) & Arrow keys for movement   [Though frankly I have a var easier time using WASD & UIOJK keys.

The differences between the classes aren't clear, though I would argue it barely matters.

The bosses ... as it were seem to have the ankle biter weakness.

Though, with this being a tablet port, & Mouse control being really only useful for the menus, and for now feeling partly like a demo.  I would honestly think that this game is wel worth it's price even if it's not updated (which I trully hope it does get updated, to atleast support MP[only SP atm]), and there is a statifying feeling of getting through the bosses then face rolling them & getting S ranks :P  (not sure if higher ranks are available, I assume not but I could be wrong)

This isn't a game I would suspect most to just sit for hours & play, but given some Keymapping to a controller, & Steam streaming.. I could easily see this being loads & loads of fun to see who can do better & such.

I had the hardest time with the butcher, & it was mostly only due to time issues (5 minute kill window for each boss), though I suspect the camera & inability to aim my weapon @ first contributed to that.  [being the only boss so far I had to restart a few times for running out of time]

If the price was higher, I would not recommend this game, but as it stands it's worth the 2$ USD, and you could honestly do alot worse then this.

I wouldn't expect controller support & it doesn't claim to have it.   There isn't much to the RPG elements, outside auto leveling, & some locked elements to the characters.  (will update if I reach the limit of it &/or it changes)
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I wouldn't even call this a game but a demo. All the bosses are just the same models but with better stats, and I didn't know wtf was going on when I first started playing because of all the Chinese letters all over the place (no english, or very little). The game looked promising but at this moment I can't recommend it to anyone to due the lack of content, language barrier , and how it looks and feels like a tablet game.

reviewText: Loved the game but its almost inposible to beat 5 bar monsters and up.The Ai on the other hunters is terrible they will litterally stand in front of the monster and get 2 hit.Then you will be left and the time will run out before you can kill the monster :/.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Worth the 2$.

Though  atm, the fiddily camera angles take alittle getting use too.

WASD works as one would expected, if there is only 4 directional input (I couldn't tell, and felt like 8 directional, with smoothing to make it look decent)
-UIO/JK Sp attack./(attack/dodge) keys work well, & they have alternate key inputs that aren't clear.
--123/qe for sp attack/(attk/dodge) & Arrow keys for movement   [Though frankly I have a var easier time using WASD & UIOJK keys.

The differences between the classes aren't clear, though I would argue it barely matters.

The bosses ... as it were seem to have the ankle biter weakness.

Though, with this being a tablet port, & Mouse control being really only useful for the menus, and for now feeling partly like a demo.  I would honestly think that this game is wel worth it's price even if it's not updated (which I trully hope it does get updated, to atleast support MP[only SP atm]), and there is a statifying feeling of getting through the bosses then face rolling them & getting S ranks :P  (not sure if higher ranks are available, I assume not but I could be wrong)

This isn't a game I would suspect most to just sit for hours & play, but given some Keymapping to a controller, & Steam streaming.. I could easily see this being loads & loads of fun to see who can do better & such.

I had the hardest time with the butcher, & it was mostly only due to time issues (5 minute kill window for each boss), though I suspect the camera & inability to aim my weapon @ first contributed to that.  [being the only boss so far I had to restart a few times for running out of time]

If the price was higher, I would not recommend this game, but as it stands it's worth the 2$ USD, and you could honestly do alot worse then this.

I wouldn't expect controller support & it doesn't claim to have it.   There isn't much to the RPG elements, outside auto leveling, & some locked elements to the characters.  (will update if I reach the limit of it &/or it changes)
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I wouldn't even call this a game but a demo. All the bosses are just the same models but with better stats, and I didn't know wtf was going on when I first started playing because of all the Chinese letters all over the place (no english, or very little). The game looked promising but at this moment I can't recommend it to anyone to due the lack of content, language barrier , and how it looks and feels like a tablet game.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Unlike what they have boasted themselves about, there's no 100+LEVELS OF DIFFERENT BOSS. Because a few levels later, all the bosses are repeating; some of them has their skin colour changed, but some of them has no changes at all, not even their name. But I'm not going to judge if you want to buy a 2 bucks game just to enjoy yourselves a little.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game was released far to early, Its real content update is on the 12th of december (pending pushbacks) It currently has no RPG elements, just a standard leveling up and fighting bosses with more and more health. This game was designed for tablets and phones but the port to PC has played out well so far. Using WASD to move UIO for abilities and JK for standard attack and roll ( you can click to move and click to activate abilities but its slow and prone to missing as its all aimed and non targeted) The creators have already given evidence of a cash shop for gear so if you are afraid of pay to win in a PVE game then this wont be for you.

This is a great page showing all their future promises with the game including PvP and co-op gaming via  wifi or mobile.

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-world-2-empire-in-the-storm

Right now i enjoy the game and it feels fluid and pretty fun altho repetative ( mostly due to them teasing me with what i could be doing like gearing up or evolving) I'd highly reccomend waiting a bit longer for this game to get your real money's worth but i wont regret spending the $2 for what ive played so far
voteText: 15 of 31 people (48%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Single player demo-showcase thingy of what supposed to be a f2p action rpg mmo coming out 12/12/14.

You get 3 characters to choose from at the start, but they all become playable after boss #5.(They also join you in combat)

The game feels like Monster Hunter if a korean mmo team made it and stripped out everything but the target monster, gave you skills, and then only 5 minutes to kill the target.

+Simple gameplay, decent graphics, runs well.
-No options (controls or otherwise)

For $1.99 - Prettygud/10. would sell virtual socks to obtain again.

I'm rather interested to see what they have planned for their real release.
voteText: 7 of 15 people (47%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Its like monster hunter but with active skills even tho its kinda like that game its still awesome
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Discovery:I happen to like straight up boss battles because I enjoy figuring out how to beat them with little to no damage to my character.\n\nGood/Bad:I have to ask, how did this game even end up being approved here in Steam? They didn’t even bother to translate the text and code the game right so how did this get past Steam’s quality control team? China's biggest action game" can be defined in a word
recommended: it feels good to rip apart the monster bosses but after a while you realize that this is really all the game has to offer since there are no ways to access the features of the game such as equipment
hoursPlayed: skills etc. The game is completely INCOMPLETE and doesn’t care that the 80 bosses advertised are merely reskins of the same low population of boss models.\n\nYou are forced to battle earlier bosses because the latest one that you have to beat is overpowered compared to your current levels. In other words
voteText: you have to grind A LOT which shouldn’t have to be the case for these types of games.\n\nSummary:This is a tablet game that should have stayed as a tablet game
votesHelpful: if you feel like endlessly smashing bosses with little to no effort and reward
votesTotal:
then this may be a game for you.

Worth: You should ask for a refund since the game is laughably incomplete.

Last Thoughts: I’d rather play Malicious on the PS3."

reviewText:
I was quite sceptical of this game when I heard of it on Greenlight, so I bought it and played it to see if it was good. And I have to say, I am not regretting my choice so far.

It's like a Monster Hunter game - you pick a hero to start with (either one of the warriors or a berserker) and slay big things! After the first set of missions, you get the other two classes added to your team, at which point you can switch your hero between the three of them and start battling against other fighters as well as bigger monsters. It did get a bit dull after a while, but is a great game when you're bored.

Probably a 9/10 from me.
voteText: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Let me start off by saying that this game is only 1.99 USD. That's cheap. Worth about as much as a soda where I live.
Okay, so, now that I've gotten that out of the way lets get to the actual review.

This is a Japanese Beat'em up/Hack and Slash designed originally for a mobile touch interface. However, they converted this over to PC, keep this in mind before you buy it and Thumbs Down it.

Pros:
-Cute chibi style graphics.
-Unique bosses and stages.
-Destinctly different characters.

Cons:
-Uses unchangable UJIO controls.
-There is no tutorial
_________________________________
Overall:
_________________________________

This game needs some work before it's Awesome" or "Great"
date: but it's not a bad 2$ game for PC.\nI think if they just added the ability to change the control key setup
recommended: this game would be loads more fun
hoursPlayed: the UJIO is wonky and unnatural. Besides that
voteText: though
helpfulPercent: it's a fun game to play when you're bored and are tired of dying constantly in Dark Souls.\n\nWould I recommend this? Yes
votesTotal: World 2 (Boss hunter) is up for some BIG updates- PvP
column16: this game will be really exciting! Character evolution/upgrading potential
column18: all to come for those who grab this tiny JRPG-Beat'em up\n\nWelp
column24: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Advertises 80 different monsters, which may be true if renaming the same four monsters 20 times each can be called different. Note also the instructions are not in english, though the game is easy enough to grasp -- I would even argue it's fun -- fancy button-mashing boss-battles, one after the other? Some people are bound to find this more fun than I did -- and that's not being mean... I just like my video game fare more cerebral. That said, it seems like this game had many more features intended, but never got implemented -- evolving and upgrading your character? COMING SOON!" (Indicated release date was December of last year for these features best as i can tell.) -- It's also implied there is supposed to be PvP battles
date: but nahh... though it is fun to fight against other heroes as well as bosses. Still... not enough there to hold my attention."
helpfulPercent: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
so far so good. the game is set to be fully released in december 2014, and im really looking forward to trying out all the new classes. currently  there is no controller support, but it is being worked on and will be added at a later date. honestly the keyboard controls worked perfectly.  i do recommand changing the camera angle (F1) in game to see what fits you best. think mine was perfect on... maybe the 4th option? i know it was centered on the boss, and that helped out so much.

if you liked the epic boss fights of sword art online or monster hunter, then you'll love this game. so far the hit detection is spot on, and the movement was very fluent.
so yeah its only $2, you got nothing to lose, so go buy it already *pokes you with a stick*

reviewText:
so far so good. the game is set to be fully released in december 2014, and im really looking forward to trying out all the new classes. currently  there is no controller support, but it is being worked on and will be added at a later date. honestly the keyboard controls worked perfectly.  i do recommand changing the camera angle (F1) in game to see what fits you best. think mine was perfect on... maybe the 4th option? i know it was centered on the boss, and that helped out so much.

if you liked the epic boss fights of sword art online or monster hunter, then you'll love this game. so far the hit detection is spot on, and the movement was very fluent.
so yeah its only $2, you got nothing to lose, so go buy it already *pokes you with a stick*

reviewText: This is not a PC game made for PC , you can baltently tell its a mobile phone game someone ported to the PC and man is it BAD!!! I only paid a buck for it and I feel so ripped off, this game isnt even worth the bandwith to download the 300 megs if it weas free.  If you're smart youll PASS this with a quickness! ♥♥♥♥ GAME!\n\nThis is by far the worst attempt at a money grab scam ive ever seen a failed mobile game being sold as a PC made game and put on steam to boot. They are lowering their standards so low its going to be impossible to buy a good trustworthy game on steam if this keeps up , its bad enough as it is but this is a whole new low.
